result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Sanato was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R. Sanato is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R. Sanato was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied  -  Balance still to be collected
$210.65 Jury Mileage, $160.00 Jury per diem, $32.58 Bailiff (1/2 day)

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay Witness fees, jury fees (20 jurors) and extra bailiff fees as determined by the Clerk of Courts office.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James R. Sanato, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Clerk: PT
No appearance by the Defendant.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $3000 Cash bond, which will be stayed until tomorrow and prior bond shall be forfeited upon effectuating the warrant.  

Same appearances as before and DE is now present in court 50 minutes late.  Court vacates warrant and bond will not be forfeited.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is now resolved.  Count 1- Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 30 days in the KCJ with Huber.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.   As a condition court orders DE to pay State's witness fees, juror fees for 20 jurors and extra bailiff fee for 1/2 day.  Atty Binger to provide court with the total cost for witness fees and Clerk's Office to determine juror and bailiff costs.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and remaining balance to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, James R. Sanato, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.   Clerk: PT
Ludwig hearing held and Atty Binger relays the offer on the record, which DE is rejecting.  Trial remains on for Monday.
